content.description: Starts in the middle of the large face at an undercling. Work straight up towards the notch at the top of the face.
content.location: The very first boulder you get to from the trail. Center of the overhanging orange face

content.description: The problem begins with a two hand start on a jug about waist level beginning on the left side of the first main boulder. The first move is a big right hand gaston with okay feet. From here, the problem features many hand and feet crossovers traversing across the left arete towards the boulder. The crux is towards the end of the traverse when moving from a sloper into the vertical crack towards the finish.
content.protection: A spotter for the beginning of the route with a crash pad for dropping down from the final hold.
content.location: Begins on the left arete of the first boulder seen from the entrance trail. The route follows the arete up to the right into a vertically diagonal crack. The final hold is where the crack finishes.
